medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent proteinuria for the past 6 months.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began two years prior with scattered light red rashes on both lower extremities, accompanied by numbness. The rash did not protrude or fade under pressure and worsened into bilateral numbness, weakness, and tingling, extending to the knees. This progression led to unstable walking and bilateral pitting edema. He received methylprednisolone a year before referral for peripheral neuropathy without improvement. After a course of rituximab, he developed nephrotic syndrome, with proteinuria increasing to 5.45g/day, while serum creatinine remained stable. One month after starting ibrutinib, nephrotic syndrome achieved complete remission, but he developed atrial fibrillation with long intervals, causing dizziness and discontinuation of ibrutinib treatment. One year later, his 24-hour urinary protein increased to 3.523g/day.
